common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Issues
common_issues.description: Users report problems with Pieces OS launching, account linking, and share link generation. Troubleshooting includes checking for duplicate installations, OneDrive interference, and account merging. Solutions involve resetting accounts, gathering system info, and awaiting new auth service.

related_issues.title: Shareable link is not generating
related_issues.text:
Shareable link is not generating
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/907584e3-3310-4866-bd26-5fbf6e371d62)
Shareable link is not generating . 
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Unable to Share Link

**Key Points:**

* User @19richa reported an issue with being unable to share a link using the Pieces app.
* The Pieces support bot provided some troubleshooting tips and related resources.
* Pieces support representative @mark-at-pieces asked for the user's email address to investigate the issue further.
* The user confirmed the issue was resolved without further assistance.

**Problems Identified:**

* The user was unable to share a link using the Pieces app.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The support bot provided troubleshooting tips and related resources.
* The support representative requested the user's email address for further investigation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue was resolved and the user confirmed it was working.

**Additional Notes:**

* The specific cause of the issue was not identified in the conversation.
* The conversation was relatively brief and only involved three messages.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Ensure core Dependencies ... (retry setup)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8b426c73-aebb-4905-857f-bdee4cad2882)
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Issue:** MR-AAYU reported issues booting up the Pieces Desktop application, causing an error message: "PiecesOS was unable to launch."

**Key Points:**

* MR-AAYU provided log files.
* Nathan at Pieces support identified duplicate Pieces for Developers installations and requested logs for Pieces OS.
* MR-AAYU provided additional logs and mentioned the error message again.
* Nathan suggested checking OneDrive and potentially booking a time for further troubleshooting.

**Problems Identified:**

* Duplicate Pieces for Developers installations.
* Difficulty launching Pieces OS.
* Potential OneDrive interference.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Removing duplicate Pieces for Developers installations.
* Checking OneDrive for interfering files.
* Gathering additional system information for diagnosis.
* Scheduling a call for further troubleshooting.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue remains unresolved.
* Further troubleshooting and potential call are needed.

**Additional Notes:**

* MR-AAYU expressed urgency in resolving the issue.
* Nathan provided helpful guidance and offered a calendar link for scheduling a call.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key points raised:**

* User (@johnkennyuk) is unable to merge their personal and Github accounts in Pieces app.
* The current account linking flow is not user-friendly.
* The user has two separate accounts registered with different email addresses (one with a capital letter).

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Merge the two accounts under the user's Google account.
* The user was asked to sign out and then sign back in with their Github account to trigger the linking flow.
* The user's Github account was reset multiple times.
* The user's email privacy setting on Github was temporarily disabled.

**Problems identified:**

* The account linking flow is not intuitive.
* A single character capitalization difference in email addresses is preventing the accounts from being merged.
* The development of a new auth service is underway, which will allow for more flexibility in account linking.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The user opted to wait for the new auth service to be released before attempting to merge their accounts again.
* The new auth service is expected to be ready in early/mid March 2025.

**Additional notes:**

* The user's Github account was reset again on February 23, 2025.
* The user will be notified when the new auth service is available and will be given priority for testing the new linking flow.

**Overall, the issue remains unresolved, but a solution is expected to be available soon.**

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Launch and Connectivity Issues
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to launch or connect to cloud services and local LLMs. This might involve error messages about cloud service connectivity or non-dismissable overlays. Troubleshooting includes verifying internet connection, checking for duplicate installations, removing personal API keys, using smaller local LLMs, and examining OneDrive for interference. Contacting support with logs is recommended for further assistance.

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Conversation Summary on Pieces Support Issue 590

**Key Points Raised:**

* ThemePark encountered an issue where the Pieces Desktop App wouldn't open after the latest Pieces OS update.
* ThemePark confirmed using Windows 10 with Pieces Suite, OS, and Desktop installed.
* They suspected a timing conflict between PiecesOS attempting to update and the Desktop App launching at startup.
* ThemePark later clarified it was Pieces for VS Code crashing after running for around 10 minutes with a message about Pieces OS not running.

**Problems Identified:**

* The Pieces Desktop App wouldn't open after the recent OS update.
* Pieces for VS Code crashes and shows a non-dismissable overlay message mentioning that Pieces OS isn't running.
* This issue impacts daily usage and hinders productivity.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **Initial Suspicion:** Conflict between PiecesOS update and Desktop App launching at startup.
* **Proposed Solution:** Change the Startup App to either PiecesOS or Desktop App, or remove both from Startup.
* **Later Clarification:** The issue occurs specifically with Pieces for VS Code crashing, not the Desktop App.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The precise cause of the crash and non-dismissable message within Pieces for VS Code remains unclear.
* ThemePark experiences the issue daily, negatively impacting workflow.
* Further investigation is necessary to identify the root cause and implement a permanent solution.

**Actionable Next Steps:**

* Pieces support team should gather further details on the crash, including logs or error messages.
* They can attempt to reproduce the issue using the provided context about VS Code usage and the timing of the crash.
* If necessary, escalating the issue to developers may be required for in-depth analysis and resolution.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## GitHub Issue Summary: Rohanrathi99's Network Issues

**Key Points:**

* Rohanrathi99 is experiencing issues making requests to PiecesOS cloud services and using local models.
* Mark-at-pieces, the Pieces support representative, requested log files for further investigation.
* Rohanrathi99 provided the requested log files.
* Mark-at-pieces identified two issues:
    * Cloud LLM issue caused by a personal OpenApi key (resolved by removing the key)
    * Local LLM issue likely due to hardware constraints (resolved by using a smaller local LLM)

**Problems Identified:**

* Firewall or network configuration blocking PiecesOS outgoing requests.
* Hardware constraints impacting local LLM performance.

**Solutions Implemented:**

* Removal of the personal OpenApi key.
* Utilization of a smaller local LLM.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Both cloud and local LLM issues have been resolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* A call was scheduled between Rohanrathi99 and Mark-at-pieces for further discussion and troubleshooting.
* The issue was closed after successful resolution.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Connectivity and Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported difficulties connecting to PiecesOS cloud services and launching the application on Linux and Windows. Troubleshooting involved checking network connectivity, removing duplicate installations, and analyzing log files. Solutions included verifying firewall settings, removing personal API keys, and using smaller local LLMs.

related_issues.title: Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.8 2025-02-17

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces for Developers hangs on first run in third step (Verify Dependency Connections) with error message

unable to open Pieces Core Services
formatexception: Invalid port (at character 16)
http://0.0.0.0:null/connect

Pieces OS seems to work fine, for a brief moment I can see its window with information that the service is active on some port. Then window closes - it is impossible to bring it back, but icon in the  system tray is still there.

How can I set proper port value for Pieces for Developer, and what is the default port value?
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User, mariusz-kowalski, reported an error when opening Pieces on their Linux machine. 
* The Pieces support bot triaged the issue and suggested relevant resources.
* Pieces support representative mark-at-pieces acknowledged the issue and mentioned a possible duplicate report.
* Another representative, mack-at-pieces, requested the user's log file and suggested a video call for troubleshooting.
* The user shared their log file but was unable to join a live session.

**Problems Identified:**

* The user encountered an error when trying to open the Pieces desktop app on a Linux machine. 
* The cause of the error was unclear, potentially related to specific Linux machines.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces support team requested the user's log file for further analysis.
* They offered a video call for real-time troubleshooting, which the user was unable to attend.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue remains open and requires further investigation.
* Pieces support team will analyze the provided log file to diagnose the problem and propose a solution.

**Additional Information:**

* The conversation indicates a possible similar issue reported through another support avenue. 
* This might suggest a broader problem affecting certain users on specific Linux machines.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Stability and Functionality Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS crashing, looping, or freezing, particularly when using features like Long Term Memory or integrations like Ollama.  Suggested solutions include disabling problematic features, ensuring Pieces OS is updated, and checking for conflicts with other applications or startup processes.  Direct support and debugging are often required to fully resolve issues.

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory engine makes piecesOs loop reload
related_issues.text:
Long Term Memory engine makes piecesOs loop reload
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I enable Long term memory engine on and use it on pieces for dev or vscode when I try to prompt anything, piecesOS shit's off and starts looping on restart until I manage in the seconds it stays on to disable the LTM engine.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**

* User (@rafael-a-g-n) reported an issue to the Pieces Support team.
* The issue was automatically triaged and assigned to the appropriate member.
* The Pieces Support bot provided relevant resources and related issues for reference.

**Problems Identified:**

* The specific issue reported by the user is not explicitly stated in the conversation. 

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* No solutions are proposed or implemented in this initial conversation. The Pieces Support team will follow up within 24 hours to investigate and address the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has been acknowledged and assigned to the Pieces Support team. The user will receive a follow-up within 24 hours. 

**Additional Notes:**

* The provided links to related issues and resources may offer helpful insights for the user while awaiting the support team's response.

related_issues.title: Installing Ollama - Forever
related_issues.text:
Installing Ollama - Forever
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/677e938c-3198-4f1b-af00-b22543704fcc)

I have Ollama installed and this is stuck like this forever. I even tried uninstalling Ollama. Still the same :-(
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@waseem852) is experiencing issues with Ollama not working in Pieces.
* They have tried installing Ollama in various ways: through Pieces setup, manually, and using winget.
* They have also tried restarting Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop and closing both apps through Task Manager.

**Problems Identified:**

* Ollama is not working in Pieces regardless of installation method.
* The user is unsure of the cause of the problem.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **Restart Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop:** Suggested bybrian-at-pieces but did not resolve the issue.
* **Jump on a call to debug:** Proposed by brian-at-pieces and accepted by user.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* A call has been scheduled to further debug the issue.

## Additional Notes

* The user is responsive and engaged in troubleshooting the issue.
* brian-at-pieces is actively assisting the user and offering solutions.
* The conversation appears to be heading towards a resolution through a collaborative effort.

I hope this summary is concise and provides the most important details.

common_issues.title: Ollama Integration Issues with Pieces OS
common_issues.description: Users report conflicts between Pieces OS's bundled Ollama instance and externally installed ones, leading to Cuda errors and startup issues. Solutions include clean Ollama reinstalls, using smaller local LLMs to address hardware constraints, and ensuring Pieces OS can access network resources for cloud services.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces OS instance's Ollama server would always give errors regarding various Cuda dll files not being registered or not found, so I then installed Ollama server from its source which works and Pieces OS could also connect too and use, the problem I'm facing now is that Pieces OS on startup seems to keep starting its own Ollama instance rather than using the externally installed Ollama server instance which means I see the Cuda dll errors again.  My workaround is that I must quit Pieces OS completely then start Ollama server from its own shortcut then start Pieces OS??

Any Ideas??
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: "Ollama Installation Errors with Pieces OS"

**Key Points:**

* User `johnkennyuk` experienced Cuda errors when using Ollama within Pieces OS. 
* Errors originated from `cublas64_12.dll`, related to Cuda 12 libraries.
* Multiple uninstalls and cleanups were attempted before the issue resolved itself unexpectedly.
* User inquired about Pieces OS's ability to detect and utilize existing external Ollama installations.

**Problems Identified:**

* Conflicting Ollama installations caused by Pieces OS's bundled version and user's manual installation.
* Race condition during startup potentially prevented Pieces OS from detecting the user's Ollama installation.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* User performed clean uninstalls and reinstalled Ollama using the official installer.
* Pieces OS team pushed a fix in version 11.1.2 to address potential race conditions.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue appears to be resolved for now, although the cause remains unclear.
* User requested further investigation into Pieces OS's ability to detect and utilize external Ollama installations. 
* Pieces OS team acknowledged the request and suggested a call to troubleshoot further.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@waseem852) is experiencing issues with Ollama not working in Pieces.
* They have tried installing Ollama in various ways: through Pieces setup, manually, and using winget.
* They have also tried restarting Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop and closing both apps through Task Manager.

**Problems Identified:**

* Ollama is not working in Pieces regardless of installation method.
* The user is unsure of the cause of the problem.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **Restart Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop:** Suggested bybrian-at-pieces but did not resolve the issue.
* **Jump on a call to debug:** Proposed by brian-at-pieces and accepted by user.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* A call has been scheduled to further debug the issue.

## Additional Notes

* The user is responsive and engaged in troubleshooting the issue.
* brian-at-pieces is actively assisting the user and offering solutions.
* The conversation appears to be heading towards a resolution through a collaborative effort.

I hope this summary is concise and provides the most important details.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## GitHub Issue Summary: Rohanrathi99's Network Issues

**Key Points:**

* Rohanrathi99 is experiencing issues making requests to PiecesOS cloud services and using local models.
* Mark-at-pieces, the Pieces support representative, requested log files for further investigation.
* Rohanrathi99 provided the requested log files.
* Mark-at-pieces identified two issues:
    * Cloud LLM issue caused by a personal OpenApi key (resolved by removing the key)
    * Local LLM issue likely due to hardware constraints (resolved by using a smaller local LLM)

**Problems Identified:**

* Firewall or network configuration blocking PiecesOS outgoing requests.
* Hardware constraints impacting local LLM performance.

**Solutions Implemented:**

* Removal of the personal OpenApi key.
* Utilization of a smaller local LLM.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Both cloud and local LLM issues have been resolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* A call was scheduled between Rohanrathi99 and Mark-at-pieces for further discussion and troubleshooting.
* The issue was closed after successful resolution.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of PiecesOS launch and connectivity issues:** This appears to be the most common problem category, impacting both Windows and Linux users. Focus on identifying the root causes, whether related to duplicate installations, OneDrive interference, network configurations, or conflicts with external Ollama instances.

**Improve Ollama integration stability:** Address conflicts between Pieces OS's bundled Ollama and external installations. Provide clear guidance on using external Ollama instances and ensure smooth integration to avoid Cuda errors and startup issues.

**Investigate and address Pieces OS stability issues:** Focus on reported crashes, loops, and freezes, especially when using Long Term Memory or Ollama. Enhance error logging and diagnostics to facilitate faster troubleshooting and resolution.

**Review and update documentation for account linking:** Given the longstanding issue with account linking, revisit and improve the documentation to provide clearer instructions and troubleshooting steps. Consider adding FAQs or video tutorials.

**Gather more detailed user feedback:** Encourage users to provide comprehensive information about their system configurations, steps to reproduce issues, and any error messages encountered. This will help in identifying patterns and resolving issues more effectively.

**Explore automation for common troubleshooting steps:** Develop automated scripts or tools to guide users through basic troubleshooting steps like checking network connectivity, verifying installations, and gathering log files. This can reduce support workload and resolution time.

**Proactively monitor for emerging issues:** Implement a system for tracking and analyzing support tickets to identify emerging trends or common problems. This will enable proactive communication and faster resolution of widespread issues.

**Consider a dedicated forum or knowledge base:** Create a centralized platform for users to find solutions, share workarounds, and discuss issues. This can foster a sense of community and reduce reliance on individual support tickets.
